page.title: 13The School. The Youth Club
page.content: The only school in our area is {Mugginton Church of England {(Controlled) Primary School.} It is in the village of Mugginton, near to the Church and the Rectory. 23 children come to the school from Mugginton, Weston Underwood and from isolated outlying farms. The date 1840 is on the outside of the building, but it is thought that the original school was established in 1746 as a Church school, funded by charity money given by Samuel and Ann Pole for teaching poor children the English language and the catechism of the Church of England. The{Youth Club}hut in Mugginton is a wooden building which was previously an Army building. It was erected by local people in 1968, and is used for a variety of activities. The school does not have a hall, so the children
